API_Description: Represents the name of the target element associated with the event.
API_Description_Reason: The property 'targetName' suggests it holds the name of the target element involved in the event, which is a common pattern in event handling to identify the element that triggered the event.
Returns: The name of the target element as a string.
Returns_Reason: Since 'targetName' is a property that likely holds the name of an element, it is reasonable to assume it returns a string representing that name.

type.description: The data type of the targetName property.
type.description_reason: The 'type' parameter is included to specify the data type of the property, which is a common practice in API documentation to clarify what kind of value is expected.
type.type_reason: The 'targetName' is expected to be a string as it represents the name of an element, which is typically a string value.
